Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Week-end \Week"-end"\, n. The end of the week, usually comprising the period from Friday evening to Monday morning, observed commonly as a period of respite from work or school; as, to visit one for a week-end; also, a house party during a week-end. Contrasted to {work days}.
Note: Where work days continue throught Saturday morning, the weekend starts on Saturday at noon. [Webster 1913 Suppl. +PJC]
weekend n : a time period usually extending from Friday night through Sunday; more loosely defined as any period of successive days including one and only one Sunday v : spend the weekend
